AD_SpawnEscapes.synopsis: One of the spawns that ambushed the player & Astarion gets teleported away.Astarion comments on that.
AD_SpawnEscapes.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Vampire AmbushWalk in the direction the characters are facing.A dialog will be started. Finish the dialog.Reduce one of the spawns below 15% of health.

AD_SpawnKidnapsAstarion.synopsis: One of the spawns grabs Astarion and teleports to Cazador's Palace with him.He says this phrase before leaving.If he is the last spawn left, he promises punishment later.If other spawns are present, he tells them to dispatch the rest of the party.

SCO_Avatar.synopsis: Astarion-avatar gets attacked by a group of vampire spawns during a long rest
SCO_Avatar.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - As Avataroe debugbookdowngrade the other avatar to companionAstarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Vampire AmbushTake a long rest

SCO_Companion.synopsis: Player and Astarion-companion get attacked by a group of vampire spawns during the night.
SCO_Companion.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Vampire AmbushTake a long rest

PAD_AstarionKidnapped.synopsis: Astarion was kidnapped by vampire spawn who ambushed you at camp during the night (CAMP_VampireAmbush_SCO_Companion.lsj).The remaining member(s) of the party comment that they need to finish the long rest before trying to find him.

AD_SpawnEscapes_0.speaker: Astarion
AD_SpawnEscapes_0.text: You can teleport now? Cazador doesn't want to lose anyone else, I suppose.
AD_SpawnEscapes_0.context: NodeContext: Just watched another vampire spawn teleport away. Astarion's a little surprised - HE can't do that...

AD_SpawnKidnapsAstarion_0.speaker: Aurelia, Leon, Violet, Yousen
AD_SpawnKidnapsAstarion_0.text: Come brother, it's time to go home.
AD_SpawnKidnapsAstarion_0.context: NodeContext: Grabbed an unconscious Astarion and is about to teleport away

AD_SpawnKidnapsAstarion_1.speaker: Aurelia, Leon, Violet, Yousen
AD_SpawnKidnapsAstarion_1.text: I'll take Astarion to the master. The rest of you - deal with the witnesses.
AD_SpawnKidnapsAstarion_1.context: NodeContext: You're about to teleport away with an unconscious person and telling your friends to keep fighting

SCO_Avatar_26.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Avatar_26.text: *Rest does not come easy tonight. Your mind considers one future after another, teasing apart the possibilities.*

SCO_Avatar_10.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Avatar_10.text: *Should you face Cazador? Should you run? And what of his ritual - this 'Ascension' - how can you turn that to your advantage?*

SCO_Avatar_12.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Avatar_12.text: *You're weighing up your prospects when a faint noise jerks you alert. There's someone in the dark...*

SCO_Avatar_68.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_68.context: NodeContext: He was creeping up on a resting Astarion, but Astarion woke up and spotted him.

SCO_Avatar_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion gets to his feet quickly, expecting a fight

SCO_Avatar_64.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_64.text: Peace, brother. We're just here to take you home.

SCO_Avatar_4.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_4.text: And if I refuse to come?

SCO_Avatar_40.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_40.text: Refuse? But 'thou shalt obey me in all things'.
SCO_Avatar_40.context: NodeContext: Quoting one of his master Cazador's rules

SCO_Avatar_61.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_61.text: It seems Petras was right - the rules no longer apply to our dear brother.

SCO_Avatar_66.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_66.text: Don't matter. The master needs all seven of us for the ritual.

SCO_Avatar_24.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_24.text: The master said bring you home - so you're coming home.

SCO_Avatar_34.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_34.text: I can beat Cazador. Follow me, help me complete the ritual, and I'll set you free.

SCO_Avatar_62.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_62.text: You do look different - stronger, fire in your eyes.

SCO_Avatar_14.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_14.text: Maybe you could take Cazador's place. Maybe you could free us.

SCO_Avatar_28.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_28.text: Easy to say, but we can't disobey the master. We're not as lucky as you, Astarion.

SCO_Avatar_53.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_53.text: Follow you? The runt of the kennel? Master's favourite toy?

SCO_Avatar_19.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_19.text: You want us to throw away our chance at freedom? On your word that you can defeat the master? Be serious.

SCO_Avatar_57.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_57.text: You were always weak, brother. We don't follow weak.

SCO_Avatar_69.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_69.text: What if we joined together? Fought Cazador together?

SCO_Avatar_16.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_16.text: Fight him? You know we can't.

SCO_Avatar_13.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_13.text: Together? Since when do you care 'bout anyone but yourself?

SCO_Avatar_50.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_50.text: What ritual? What are you talking about?

SCO_Avatar_45.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_45.text: You don't know? The Rite of Profane Ascension.

SCO_Avatar_44.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_44.text: The master's holding a Black Mass. That's where he'll ascend, and we'll get to live again.

SCO_Avatar_2.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_2.text: The scars he carved into our backs bind us to the ritual. Seven spawn, seven sigils.

SCO_Avatar_48.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_48.text: And you're number seven - the final piece of the Rite. He needs us all for the Black Mass.

SCO_Avatar_72.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_72.text: We'll walk in the sun. We'll finally be free, brother.

SCO_Avatar_29.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_29.text: Listen to me, this ritual of Cazador's - we're part of it. He's going to sacrifice us all!

SCO_Avatar_15.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_15.text: Of course not, the master needs us. We're loyal. And more to the point, we're useful.

SCO_Avatar_5.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_5.text: But if brother's right, we're more useful to him dead.

SCO_Avatar_70.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_70.text: Then we'll die! Unlike our sweet brother, we've no choice but to obey.

SCO_Avatar_59.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_59.text: Master said bring him home. Master said to fight... Never forbade us from talking, though.

SCO_Avatar_22.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_22.text: Sorry, brother. This is the best we can do.

SCO_Avatar_20.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_20.text: Of course not, the master's no fool. He needs us.

SCO_Avatar_6.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_6.text: And he needs you, Astarion. It's time to come home.

SCO_Avatar_36.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_36.text: I'm not going anywhere with you.

SCO_Avatar_17.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_17.text: You're not listening, brother. You have to come with us.

SCO_Avatar_55.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_55.text: When the master ascends, he'll take us with him. We'll all be free.

SCO_Avatar_60.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_60.text: We'll walk in the sun. We won't feel hungry all the time. We'll be living vampires.

SCO_Avatar_31.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_31.text: It's a lie - Cazador would never share power with us.

SCO_Avatar_25.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_25.text: You may be free of his rules, but we're not.

SCO_Avatar_32.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_32.text: Not with you, maybe. Not with the runt of the kennel.

SCO_Avatar_47.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_47.text: We've listened to you for long enough, brother. We have our commands.

SCO_Avatar_56.speaker: Leon
SCO_Avatar_56.text: The master told us to take you alive. 'As broken as possible, but alive.'

SCO_Avatar_1.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_1.text: The master said you might offer to come willing, but his orders were very specific.

SCO_Avatar_9.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_9.text: Still picking fights you can't win? You always were pig-headed, brother.

SCO_Avatar_71.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Avatar_71.text: Looks like the rules no longer apply to our dear brother. Curious.

SCO_Companion_89.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_89.text: You haven't spent much time with my family.

SCO_Companion_64.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_64.text: The master said to take our brother alive. Didn't say anything about you.

SCO_Companion_169.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_169.text: Listen to me, this ceremony is a mass sacrifice - Cazador is going to kill you all!

SCO_Companion_13.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_13.text: It wouldn't be the worst thing he's ever done to us. You know I'm right, sister.

SCO_Companion_96.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_96.text: Perhaps, but even if this is true, we're bound. We can't disobey him.

SCO_Companion_118.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_118.text: I can. I can stop him, but you have to tell me what you know.

SCO_Companion_145.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_145.text: Master said bring him home. Never forbade us from talking, though.

SCO_Companion_48.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_48.text: That's true. We can say whatever we like, once we're trying to take him back.

SCO_Companion_61.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_61.text: Sorry, brother, orders is orders. This is the best we can do.

SCO_Companion_93.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_93.text: Of course not, the master's no fool. He needs us.

SCO_Companion_55.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_55.text: And when he doesn't need you anymore? What then, sister?

SCO_Companion_117.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_117.text: We have been his servants for centuries, he has always needed us!

SCO_Companion_82.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_82.text: And he needs you, Astarion. It's time to come home.

SCO_Companion_68.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_68.text: What a mess. Well, at least you've met my family now.

SCO_Companion_77.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_77.text: I can't believe how you lied to them. You know they'll have to die for the Rite to happen.

SCO_Companion_168.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_168.text: What does it matter? There's only six of them. And they are vampire spawn.

SCO_Companion_99.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_99.text: You don't have sympathy for others sharing your plight?

SCO_Companion_51.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_51.text: No one ever looked out for me. No one ever said a kind thing to me.

SCO_Companion_142.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_142.text: You're the only one. Other people don't have a heart like you. You're you. No one is like that.

SCO_Companion_21.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_21.text: The world can be a wonderful, kind place, Astarion, when you find a home in it.

SCO_Companion_155.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_155.text: You say, as a mind flayer thrall who spends their life sorting out other people's problems.

SCO_Companion_90.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_90.text: I'm doing this for you, too, you know. To make sure we're both safe. Forever, for good.

SCO_Companion_153.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_153.text: But... perhaps there's something in what you say.

SCO_Companion_10.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_10.text: There are many others like me who will care for you, if you care for them.

SCO_Companion_163.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_163.text: Ah, don't sell yourself so short.

SCO_Companion_154.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_154.text: I am rather special, aren't I?

SCO_Companion_45.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_45.text: We aren't like them. We are better.

SCO_Companion_27.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_27.text: Don't act haughty, you're only one tadpole away from being one of them.

SCO_Companion_126.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_126.text: In turn, what does your life matter?

SCO_Companion_140.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_140.text: We should try to save them, before it's too late.

SCO_Companion_71.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_71.text: Why bother? They seem to like their torturer, now. What does it matter if they end up dead?

SCO_Companion_72.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_72.text: Even if they're misled, they're in danger.

SCO_Companion_148.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_148.text: A few tendays ago, you too would've leapt at the hope that Cazador might free you.

SCO_Companion_112.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_112.text: Everything has changed. What matters now is that I can stand up to Cazador.

SCO_Companion_26.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_26.text: Had we killed them, Cazador wouldn't be able to complete the Rite.

SCO_Companion_125.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_125.text: He wouldn't throw away centuries of planning on a scrap like this. They were pulled back just in time.

SCO_Companion_128.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_128.text: Was it true what they said? That you gave up fighting him long ago?

SCO_Companion_79.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_79.text: You don't know what it was like. There was no way out.

SCO_Companion_24.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_24.text: Once - in the first decade of my slavery - I found a darling boy who I couldn't bear to bring back to him. So I ran, instead of hurting that sweet man.

SCO_Companion_59.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_59.text: After Cazador caught me, the bastard sealed me, starving, inside a dusty tomb, all on my own, for an entire year.

SCO_Companion_31.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_31.text: A year of silence. Months of scratching my hands raw, trying to carve my way out. More months of not moving at all. Months wishing only for death.

SCO_Companion_29.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_29.text: So don't you ever judge me for doing what Cazador ordered.

SCO_Companion_14.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_14.text: I have no words. I'm so sorry.

SCO_Companion_110.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_110.text: Nothing can make up for that. Not even Cazador's death.

SCO_Companion_100.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_100.text: But to steal his life's work... that might be something.

SCO_Companion_85.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_85.text: No, he didn't. I am still here. And I will fight him until I fight my last.

SCO_Companion_108.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_108.text: And while repaying what he did to me is impossible, I am damn well going to steal that bastard's life work. I will become the Ascendant.

SCO_Companion_167.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_167.text: Still, you shouldn't have given up.

SCO_Companion_41.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_41.text: Easy to say the words, isn't it?

SCO_Companion_44.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_44.text: Move forward, and get your revenge.

SCO_Companion_4.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_4.text: The way they contorted... they were compelled by Cazador, weren't they?

SCO_Companion_156.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_156.text: Yes. They cannot fight his compulsion. But I can, thanks to our wriggling friend.

SCO_Companion_40.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_40.text: Cazador's bond forced their hands against us - can he still force yours?

SCO_Companion_109.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_109.text: Ha! He cannot, thanks to our wriggling friend.

SCO_Companion_11.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_11.text: He will be furious. And he'll be even more furious when I get to that crypt and stop him.

SCO_Companion_37.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_37.text: For what it's worth, thank you. No matter what happens down there, you helped me stand up against him.

SCO_Companion_22.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_22.text: I hope we can get some rest now.

SCO_Companion_88.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_88.text: You said they could take me? Really?

SCO_Companion_119.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_119.text: Ugh. Well, I suppose you knew we could defeat them. I'll try not to think what would have happened if we hadn't.

SCO_Companion_92.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_92.text: At least you've met my family now.

SCO_Companion_103.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_103.text: And that was your gut response? Really?

SCO_Companion_151.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_151.text: I can't tell whether you're a bad liar or a worse jester, but either way, it isn't cute.

SCO_Companion_78.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_78.text: Sorry, sweetheart, but consider our little love affair over. I don't want to be with anyone who has kidnapping fantasies about their partner.

SCO_Companion_150.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_150.text: *You sleep, but the wicked don't. Someone is here to disturb your rest...*

SCO_Companion_20.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_20.text: Get the hells away from me!
SCO_Companion_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion standing, facing the two vampire spawn that have sneaked into your camp

SCO_Companion_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets up from their bedroll where they've been meditating

SCO_Companion_120.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_120.text: Peace, brother. We're here to take you home.

SCO_Companion_138.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_138.text: The master needs all seven of us for the ceremony. Come with us and be reborn. We'll live again.

SCO_Companion_95.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_95.text: What does Cazador want with him?

SCO_Companion_94.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_94.text: The Rite... The master needs him. He must attend.

SCO_Companion_172.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_172.text: Oh, I'm well aware of what the master needs. But don't we deserve better?

SCO_Companion_16.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_16.text: After these centuries of torment, I know what you all want. More than power. More than to walk in the sun.

SCO_Companion_34.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_34.text: You want to see him dead.

SCO_Companion_115.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_115.text: The Rite of Profane Ascension will be mine, and he won't see a scrap of its glory. I am going to complete the ritual as the Ascendant, and then I am going to kill him.

SCO_Companion_107.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_107.text: This is your chance. Stand with me. Name me your new master. We will get our revenge, and you will all live again.

SCO_Companion_157.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_157.text: *His liar's smile spells danger. He knows full well that his kin will die in the ritual.*

SCO_Companion_101.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_101.text: *But if any of the bearers of the scar die before the ritual begins, he will lose his chance to perform the Rite himself.*

SCO_Companion_173.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_173.text: *He needs them to run willingly to their deaths, thinking they stand a chance against their master.*

SCO_Companion_73.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_73.text: Have you no heart, Astarion? You're asking them to die for you in this ritual.

SCO_Companion_102.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_102.text: Don't look at me like that. With the sweet little 'disappointed I'm not getting cuddly Astarion' pout. I can't take it. I can't be what you want to see in me.
SCO_Companion_102.context: NodeContext: really does believe he went too far

SCO_Companion_114.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_114.text: 'Die' in the ritual? Whatsoever are you speaking of? We are going to cheat undeath.

SCO_Companion_54.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_54.text: You're slaughter-lambs, all. Cazador needs your souls.

SCO_Companion_33.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_33.text: We can save you. Let us help.

SCO_Companion_58.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_58.text: Come on, use your pretty heads. The ritual is a sacrifice.

SCO_Companion_139.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_139.text: The master doesn't need to lie to us. He controls us, fully. Why go through the trouble of giving us hope...

SCO_Companion_143.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_143.text: We're doomed. All right - what do you need from us? We'll help you...

SCO_Companion_132.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_132.text: I'm doing what I have to... I can't be what you want to see in me.

SCO_Companion_38.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_38.text: Don't spoil this for me. I almost had them -

SCO_Companion_106.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_106.text: Enough! Enough talk and enough lies.

SCO_Companion_12.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_12.text: He's free of Cazador's command. You should follow him. He will save you.

SCO_Companion_1.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_1.text: You're free of him? Petras was right - you've changed. Maybe you could complete the ritual. Maybe you could free us.

SCO_Companion_180.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_180.text: Perhaps we can get back at Cazador, and finish the ritual. The seven can unite -

SCO_Companion_2.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_2.text: He is different - stronger, fire in his eyes.  Maybe he could take Cazador's place. Maybe he could free us.

SCO_Companion_86.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_86.text: Save us? That lickspittle only ever wanted to save himself - the rest of us be damned.

SCO_Companion_171.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_171.text: And now you think we'll throw away our chance at freedom? By bowing to you?

SCO_Companion_133.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_133.text: You were always weak, brother. We don't follow weak.

SCO_Companion_131.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_131.text: Why should we let Cazador have all the fun? After all he's done to us.

SCO_Companion_17.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_17.text: Vengeance will taste sweet, paired with Ascension.

SCO_Companion_28.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_28.text: You think he's ever kept a promise? He will never let us be free... You all know that.

SCO_Companion_7.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_7.text: Astarion has the strength to defeat Cazador. We should stand together.

SCO_Companion_141.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_141.text: Stand with the runt of the kennel? The one who always whimpered while he got beat?

SCO_Companion_49.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_49.text: We are going to kill him, and anything that gets in our way.

SCO_Companion_80.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_80.text: Runt, we've spoken of vengeance time and again, and you never listened.

SCO_Companion_67.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_67.text: What a lovely invitation, but I'm afraid I'll have to decline. I intend to kill him, you see?

SCO_Companion_162.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_162.text: We will live again, Astarion. The scars on our backs are sealed with the cruellest power. Seven spawn, seven sigils.

SCO_Companion_116.speaker: Leon
SCO_Companion_116.text: You're number seven - the final piece of the Rite. He needs us all for the Black Mass.

SCO_Companion_113.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_113.text: Our fates were sealed in his writing long ago. A promise to his favourite spawn, fulfilled in the crypt beneath his palace.

SCO_Companion_135.context: CinematicNodeContext: The spawn have a light glow come over them, begin to feel feral, Cazador's compulsion is coming over them.

SCO_Companion_63.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_63.text: The bond's hold. He owns us. We have no choice, we must obey. Get out of here, Astarion, before...
SCO_Companion_63.context: NodeContext: Last phrase is the moment Cazador takes control of them. They are giving Astarion a final warning to run away.

SCO_Companion_42.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_42.text: This is our only chance to be free, to end centuries of slavery. You will not ruin it, Astarion!

SCO_Companion_52.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_52.text: Master Cazador has known where Astarion was this entire time. He knew he would return.

SCO_Companion_3.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_3.text: Take him if you want, just keep it down. I'm trying to rest.

SCO_Companion_0.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_0.text: Thank you for your unerring support.

SCO_Companion_137.speaker: Aurelia
SCO_Companion_137.text: Much as we'd love to, the master's orders were very specific.

SCO_Companion_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets up from their bedroll where they've been sleeping

SCO_Companion_174.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_174.text: This needs to end, one way or another.

SCO_Companion_134.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_134.text: They mentioned my scars and a rite... I need to get to that crypt and find out what these damn markings are really for.

PAD_AstarionKidnapped_2.speaker: Player
PAD_AstarionKidnapped_2.text: Damn it, Astarion's probably been whisked back to Cazador by now.

PAD_AstarionKidnapped_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AstarionKidnapped_0.text: It'd be madness to attack a vampire stronghold at night. Better just rest and wait for sunrise.

PAD_AstarionKidnapped_3.speaker: Player
PAD_AstarionKidnapped_3.text: They got Astarion, damn it. He's probably back at Cazador's palace already.

PAD_AstarionKidnapped_1.speaker: Player
PAD_AstarionKidnapped_1.text: We can't attack a vampire's stronghold at night. The best we can do for him now is rest and wait for sunrise.
